author: haskellcoding
title: Building Cardano glossary
description: 对于Cardano的大规模采用，技术上的大众化理解是必不可少的，但很少有英文以及本地提供。

f6_assessments.q0:
The idea of having a glossary in several laguages is good but proposal is poor.

What languages will be contemplated in this project? How the content will be avilable? How tit will be communicated within communicated and to new comers? How the quality of the translation will be verified?

The project is simple but the aforementioned details should be provided. Maybe this glossary could be built by the community together, little by little, following an wikipedia model.
f6_assessments.q1:
Very vague description of the proposer. Transating terms to several languagues will require a lot of people who are not engaged yet.

No implementation plan or budget breakdown provided, only a vague goal. It would be nice to see the steps on selecting the languages, pick the content to translate, choorse the platform/model, communicate, collect feedback, etc.
f6_assessments.q2:
No kpis provided and no milestones (since theres no plan).
As metrics, I'd add the number of terms translated, the number of languages translated to, the number of accesss, the number of likes, the number of comments, the number of translators, etc. All should be time related and with some target.

f6_assessments.q0:
The identified problem and the solution to the problem don't entirely fit into the challenge objectives. The goal of the proposal should be about getting more people into the Cardano community by providing enough materials in their native language (in this particular case, Korean and Japanese).

If the technical content is chosen, the proposer should draw a working project having in mind this possible direction (as an example), from the challenge brief: "Number of courses translated to different languages, from programming to stakepool operation and so on."
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal doesn't have a roadmap with milestones and the budget is not broken down into identifiable items (i.e. 1xJapanese translator x 3 papers x 3000 words x $.10/word = $900, 1 license for a text editor app = 20$ etc.).

The proposer should add relevant info about the translators experience (sustained by trails from public sources, if available, social media links etc.).

KPIs/metrics should be defined to measure the output of the actions taken (no. of unique downloads for the A1 paper, no. of unique viewers for the V1 video, both for a predefined period of time etc.)
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal lacks important information, such as roadmap, estimates of content to be produced, details on budget allocation and details about the proposers' experience.

Based on what info is available, there is nothing to assess.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal identifies the problem of little technical information being disclosed and proposes as a solution the creation of a dictionary that explains technical terms related to Cardano to facilitate people's understanding. It is a good idea with potential to help the community to attract new non-English speakers, but the proposer does not explain in which languages this dictionary will be created. Despite this, the proposal is in line with the multilingual challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer does not show any evidence of his abilities and also does not clarify if he will have other people helping him in the project. The budget has not been detailed so it is not possible to assess whether the asking price is reasonable. The proposal also does not set a deadline for completion. In addition, the resources needed to carry out the project are not described. It would also be very important for the evaluation that the proposer describe his plan for implementing the work, clarifying all the steps of what will be done and how it will be done.
f6_assessments.q2: The target problem and its solution were clearly described. The proposal did not present a roadmap with milestones. It also did not provide key metrics or KPIs and did not set a deadline for completing the work. Without this information it is not possible to assess the progress and success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal has no information to help determine whether it meets the criteria of the challenge. As such, since no information is given I cannot say that it addresses the challenge.  You can improve by working on understanding the feasibility of the project and how it provides a solution to the challenge statement.

If this does not receive funding for whatever reason, one way proposer can improve it is by continuing to build and send press releases to media of your country or social media relating to your subject. Sometimes that one step might motivate someone to view the link and add credibility for your project and give him a better idea on the project which enables him to vote for the project. 

You can also look more into developing a contingency plan if for any reason your original plan does not work out. This planning is very favorable when CAs and voters consider proposals since more often than not, what we think will happen wont happen but some complication or issue will arise.

I am qualified to write this assessment based on being a translator since 1992 at the State Broadcasting Corporation as well as since that time,running my own translation agency, working with the two native languages of my country as well as working on various translation projects into other languages, including translation, transcription and proofreading.
f6_assessments.q1:
No invormation is available regarding the proposer. No Linkedin Profile. No GIthub.  There is no budget or breakdown of costs or expenses given.  Therefore I cannot  recommend that this proposal would be implemented successfully.  While you will achieve success if you fix the issues given as constructive feedback above..

A piece of advice... You can also look more into developing a contingency plan if for any reason your original plan does not work out. This planning is very favorable when CAs and voters consider proposals since more often than not, what we think will happen wont happen but some complication or issue will arise. A proposer who has considered this, would be looked on more favorably since it shows that they are prepared for various situations and eventualities
f6_assessments.q2:
No timetable of activities, metrics or KPIs have been given. No planning has been stated for contingencies or emergencies. There is no indication of what the proposer plans to do in terms of creating this gloasary. Therefore there is a c omplete lack of information regarding the effectiveness of this proposal. 

Nonetheless one piece of advice for the proposer.  Make as many metrics which you can track easily. Use Trello or Notion or some similar project management tool.

f6_assessments.q0:
"I really like the idea of ​​building a web dictionary that can explain technical terms related to Cardano in an easy-to-understand manner.
Because there are many terms mentioned in blockchain and Cardano videos that not many people can understand such as: AMM, Liquidity Pool, Staking, Mining,.......
Having a dictionary of these terms can help people quickly look up for a more thorough understanding of blockchain and Cardano videos. If this dictionary is implemented, it will bring a huge benefit to the community who want to study and learn information about blockchain and Cardano.
But I see in this proposal that all are ideas, not a specific plan. On which platform will this dictionary be deployed, website, app?
What are its features?"
f6_assessments.q1:
"Proposer claims that he/she has translated some of IOHK blog posts into Japanese and Korean, and regularly posts them to the cardano forum and official community. But the proposer did not specify which forums and communities. Therefore, it is difficult to verify this information.
Besides, the lack of a specific plan and product also makes this proposal not highly feasible"
f6_assessments.q2: There is no detailed plan of what the funds will be used to produce which can be assessed against. Thus progress and success cannot be measured. It is not clear what, if anything has already been built.

f6_assessments.q0: This problem was to make Cardano more accessible to non-english speakers, the idea this person has provided helps mainly english speakers and not people who speak other languages.
f6_assessments.q1: This person has provided no plan and more information would be necessary to make it an eligible idea. They do however have some  experience in this area from translating blogs into Japanese and Korean.
f6_assessments.q2: This is a good idea however there was not enough information or even a plan to direct this idea to success. They have asked for a large amount of money with no budget plan making a way to audit this proposal nearly impossible.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea of building a glossary for Cardano addresses the challenge. However, the proposal is not completely written.
f6_assessments.q1: As it is not completely written, there is no timeline, team, budget breakdown, development plan. I disagree that this proposal will be successfully implemented.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal doesn't provide me enough information to assess its progress. There is no metrics for success, KPIs or risks.

f6_assessments.q0:
For the mass adoption of the Cardano, technical mass understanding is essential. This project will build a web dictionary that can explain technical terms related to Cardano in an easy-to-understand manner.
However, to assess whether a project can solve the challenge or not, it is necessary to rely on many factors. In this proposal, I see no mention of how to attract people to Cardano glossary (marketing,...). Determining the target audience is also very important, it helps people visualize the market (survey and statistics on the number of users participating in Cardano using Korean and Japanese).
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposers mentioned "I have translated some of IOHK blog posts into Japanese and Korean, and regularly posts them to the cardano forum and official community." Are those experiences enough to carry out the project? It would be helpful to provide additional profiles (i.e. Linkedin profiles), links to the activities mentioned (IOHK posts once translated). Here, the proponent does not provide team information, I think implementing the project with the help of the team will be much easier. Each person on the team will take on a specific job, calculate the number of hours worked, the hourly wage, thus allocating the budget appropriately, helping the project develop in the long run.
No roadmap/KPI/success is provided. Having a specific roadmap is very necessary, it helps everyone to evaluate the success and progress of work. Clearly define goals in each period (3 months, 6 months, 12 months,...)
With the little information provided, I think this proposal is difficult to implement.
f6_assessments.q2: As mentioned in the previous section, the content provided is very little, it is not enough to evaluate the progress or success of the proposal. Need to add a lot of content. The implementation of a project if it is not enough to rely on just one person, need the help of a team. Ask for a budget of $10,000, however need to provide how the funds will be spent. There should be a detailed roadmap, clearly defining the work in each stage. Having success metrics is very helpful, making it easy for everyone to track and evaluate.

solution: 这个项目将建立一个网络词典，能够以一种易于理解的方式解释与Cardano有关的技术术语。
experience: 我把IOHK的一些博客文章翻译成日语和韩语，并定期发布到Cardano论坛和官方社区。
